other_tests.findings: Reactivity only to antigens from the house-dust mite.

Forced vital capacity (FVC) of 3.62 liters (91% of predicted); forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1) of 2.67 liters (83% of predicted); normal FEV1:FVC ratio of 0.73; total lung capacity measured at 6.03 liters (102% of predicted); residual volume of 2.41 liters (122% of predicted); flow-volume loop was normal.
Normal vocal-cord movement; no structural abnormalities in the upper airway.

Trachea narrowed dramatically during exhalation, particularly when the patient coughed, leaving only a thin crescentic lumen for airflow. Anterior bulging of the posterior membranous sheath throughout the length of the trachea and expiratory narrowing of both main-stem bronchi.
